sample(n_samples, p=None)[source]¶
class cortex.models.distributions.Distribution(dim, name='distribution', must_sample=False, scale=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

Distribution parent class.

Not meant to be used alone, use subclass.

has_kl¶

bool – convenience for if distribution subclass has exact KL.

is_continuous¶

bool – whether distribution is continuous (as opposed to discrete).

dim¶

int – dimension of distribution.

must_sample¶

bool – whether sampling is required for calculating density.

scale¶

int – scaling for distributions whose probs are higher order, such as Gaussian, which has mu and sigma.

f_sample¶

Optional[function] – sampling function.

f_neg_log_prob¶

Optional[function] – negative log probability funciton.

f_entropy¶

Optional[function] – entropy function.

entropy(p=None)[source]¶

Entropy function.

Parameters:p (T.tensor) – probability.
Returns:entropy.
Return type:T.tensor

Parameters:p (T.tensor) – probability.
Returns:center of distribution.
Return type:T.tensor

For use in RBMs and other energy based models.

Parameters:
  • x (T.tensor) – input.
  • z (T.tensor) – distribution tensor.

Fetches distribution parameters.

is_continuous = False

Laplace distribution.

class cortex.models.distributions.Logistic(dim, name='logistic', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.distributions.Distribution

Logistic distribution.

\(p(x)=\frac{e^{\frac{x - \mu}{s}}}{s(1+e^{\frac{x - \mu}{s}})^2}\)

Note

Not to be confused with logistic function.

Conditional distribution.

Conditional distributions do not own their parameters, they are given, such as from an MLP.

Returns:Conditional.

cortex.models.gru module¶

Module for GRU layers

class cortex.models.gru.GRU(dim_in, dim_hs, input_net_aux=None, name='gru', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.rnn.RNN

call_seqs(x, condition_on, level, *params)[source]¶
static factory(data_iter=None, dim_in=None, dim_out=None, dim_hs=None, i_net=None, a_net=None, o_net=None, c_net=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Factory for creating MLPs for GRU and returning instance.

Convenience to quickly create MLPs from dictionaries, linking all relevent dimensions and distributions.

Parameters:
  • dim_in – int, input dimention.
  • dim_hs – list of int, dimensions of reccurent units.
  • data_iter – Dataset object, provides dimension and distribution info.
  • dim_out – int (optional), output dimension. If not provided, assumed to be dim_in.
  • i_net – dict, input network args.
  • o_net – dict, output network args.
  • c_net – dict, conditional network args.
Returns:

GRU object
Return type:

GRU

cortex.models.helmholtz module¶

Module for Helmhotlz machines.

SBNs, GBNs, etc. Networks with DARN components should also be trainable with this class.

class cortex.models.helmholtz.Helmholtz(posterior, conditional, prior, name=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

Generic Helmholtz machine class.

SBNs, GBNs (VAE), and other prior distributions supported here. Only single latent layer for this class. See DeepHelmholtz. Use Helmholtz.factory for simple SBN.

posterior¶

MLP, approximate posterior distribution network. (aka inference net or recognition net)

conditional¶

MLP, conditional network.

prior¶

Distribution, prior distribution of latent variables.

static factory(dim_h, data_iter=None, distributions=None, dims=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Factory for forming conditional, posterior, and prior.

Parameters:
  • dim_h – int, latent dimension.
  • data_iter – Dataset class.
  • **kwargs – kwargs for mlp_factory
Returns:

Helmholtz object.
generate_from_latent(h)[source]¶

Generates an image from a latent state.

get_center(p)[source]¶

Returns the center of the conditional distribution.

get_params()[source]¶

Get model parameters.

get_posterior_params(*params)[source]¶

Get the posterior params for scan.

get_prior_params(*params)[source]¶

Get the prior params for scan.

init_inference_samples(size)[source]¶

Initializes the samples for inference.

l2_decay(rate)[source]¶

Get L2 decay costs.

log_marginal(y, h, py, q)[source]¶

Computes the approximate log marginal.

Uses log sum p / q - log N

Parameters:
  • y – T.tensor, target values.
  • h – T.tensor, latent samples.
  • py – T.tesnor, conditional density p(y | h)
  • q – approximate posterior q(h | y)
Returns:

approximate log marginal.
static mlp_factory(dim_h, data_iter=None, distributions=None, dims=None, prior=None, rec_args=None, gen_args=None)[source]¶

Factory for forming conditional, posterior, and prior.

Parameters:
  • dim_h – int, latent dimension.
  • data_iter – Dataset class (optional). Must be provided if distributions and dims are not
  • distributions – dict (optional). keys are data mode names, values are str for distribution (see distributions.py)
  • dims – dict (optional). Keys are data mode names, values are int.
  • prior – str or Distribution object (optional), type (str) or instance of prior. See distributions.py.
  • rec_args – dict (optional), arguments for approximate posterior.
  • gen_args – dict (optional), arguments for conditional network.
Returns:

MLP. posterior: MLP. prior: Distribution.
Return type:

conditional
p_y_given_h(h, *params)[source]¶

p(y | h) for scan.

sample_from_prior(n_samples=100)[source]¶

Samples from the prior distribution.

set_params()[source]¶
set_tparams()[source]¶
visualize_latents()[source]¶

Visualizes influence of latent variables on input space.

Takes the difference between “on” and “off” units (defined by prior). See distributions.py for details.

Function to unpack pretrained model into fresh Helmholtz class.

See Helmholtz.factory for details.

cortex.models.mlp module¶

Module for MLP model.

class cortex.models.mlp.MLP(dim_in, dim_out, dim_h=None, n_layers=None, dim_hs=None, h_act='T.nnet.sigmoid', distribution='binomial', distribution_args=None, name='MLP', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

Multilayer perceptron model.

dim_in¶

int – input dimension.

dim_out¶

int – output dimension.

distribution¶

Optional[Distribution] – distribution of output. Used for sampling, density calculations, etc.

dim_h¶

Optional[int] – dimension of hidden layer.

dim_hs¶

Optional[list] – for multiple hidden layers.

n_layers¶

int – number of output and hidden layers.

h_act¶

str – hidden activation string.

cortex.models.rbm module¶

Module for RBM class.

class cortex.models.rbm.RBM(dim_v, dim_h, mean_image=None, name='rbm', v_dist='binomial', h_dist='binomial', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

RBM class.

Currently supports only binary hidden units.

h_dist¶

Distribution – conditional distribution of hiddens.

v_dist¶

Distribution – conditional distribution of visibles.

dim_h¶

int – number of hidden units.

dim_v¶

int – number of visible units.

W¶

T.tensor – weights

log_Z¶

T.tensor – current approximation of the log marginal.

std_log_Z¶

T.tensor – current std of the approximate log marginal.

mean_image¶

T.tensor – used for marginal approximation.

ais(K, M)[source]¶

Performs AIS to estimate the log of the partition function, Z.

Note

Only works for Binomial / Binomial.

Parameters:
  • K (int) – Number of annealing steps.
  • M (int) – Number of annealing runs.
Returns:

\(log Z_a\). T.tensor: \(d \log Z\). T.tensor: variance of \(d \log Z\). T.tensor: log weights. T.tensor: samples.
Return type:

T.tensor
energy(v, h)[source]¶

Energy of a visible, hidden configuration.

Parameters:
  • v (T.tensor) – visible sample.
  • h (T.tensor) – hidden sample.
Returns:

energies.
Return type:

T.tensor

Estimate the \(-\log p(x)\) using the estimate of \(log_Z\).

Returns:NLL estimate.
Return type:T.tensor

sample(h0, n_steps=1)[source]¶

Gibbs sampling function.

Sampling starts from hidden state (arbitrary design choice).

Parameters:
  • h0 (T.tensor) – Initial hidden layer state.
  • n_steps (int) – number of Gibbs steps.
Returns:

all of the visible and hidden states as well as the probability densities from Gibbs sampling. theano.OrderedUpdates: updates.
Return type:

OrderedDict

step_gibbs(r_h, r_v, h, *params)[source]¶

Step Gibbs sample.

Parameters:
  • r_h (theano.randomstream) – random variables for hiddens.
  • r_v (theano.randomstream) – random variables for visibles.
  • h (T.tensor) – hidden state.
  • *params – theano shared variables.
Returns:

hidden samples. T.tensor: visible samples. T.tensor: conditional hidden probability. T.tensor: conditional visible probability.
Return type:

T.tensor
step_gibbs_ais(r_h_a, r_h_b, r_v, v, beta, W_a, b_a, c_a, W_b, b_b, c_b)[source]¶

Step Gibbs sample for AIS.

Gibbs sampling for the transition operator that keeps \(p^{\star}_{k-1}\) invariant.

Note

Only works for Binomial / Binomial RBMs

Parameters:
  • r_h_a (T.tensor) – random tensor for sampling h_a.
  • r_h_b (T.tensor) – random tensor for sampling h_b.
  • r_v (T.tensor) – random tensor for sampling v.
  • v (T.tensor) –
  • beta (float) – annealing factor.
  • b_a, c_a (W_a,) – parameters of RBM a.
  • b_b, c_b (W_b,) – parameters of RBM b.
Returns:

sample \(v_k \sim T_{k-1}(.|v_{k-1})\).
Return type:

T.tensor
step_ph_v(x, *params)[source]¶

cortex.models.rnn module¶

Module for RNN layers.

class cortex.models.rnn.RNN(dim_in, dim_hs, dim_out=None, conditional=None, input_net=None, output_net=None, name='rnn', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

RNN class.

Implements a generic multilayer RNN.

dim_in¶

int – input dimension.

dim_out¶

int – output dimension.

dim_hs¶

list – dimenstions of recurrent units.

n_layers¶

int – number of recurrent layers. Should match len(dim_hs).

input_net¶

MLP – MLP to feed input into recurrent layers.

output_net¶

MLP – MLP to read from recurrent layers.

condtional¶

Optional[MLP] – MLP to condition output on previous output.

nets¶

list – list of networks. input network, output_net, conditional.

inter_nets¶

list – list of inter-networks between recurrent layers.

call_seqs(x, condition_on, level, *params)[source]¶

Prepares the input for __call__

Parameters:
  • x (T.tensor) – input
  • condtion_on (T.tensor or None) – tensor to condition recurrence on.
  • level (int) – reccurent level.
  • *params – list of theano.shared.
Returns:

list of scan inputs.
Return type:

list

static factory(data_iter=None, dim_in=None, dim_out=None, dim_h=None, dim_hs=None, i_net=None, o_net=None, c_net=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Factory for creating MLPs for RNN and returning .

Convenience to quickly create MLPs from dictionaries, linking all relevent dimensions and distributions.

Parameters:
  • dim_in (int) – input dimention.
  • dim_h (Optional[int]) – dimension of recurrent unit for single layer.
  • dim_hs (list) – dimensions of recurrent units.
  • data_iter (Dataset) – provides dimension and distribution info.
  • dim_out (Optional[int]) – output dimension. If not provided, assumed to be dim_in.
  • i_net (dict) – input network args.
  • o_net (dict) – output network args.
  • c_net (dict) – conditional network args.
Returns:

RNN

Samples from an initial state.

Parameters:

  • h0 (Optional[T.tensor]) – initial recurrent state.

  • n_steps (int) – number of sampling steps.

dictionary of results. hiddens, probabilities, and preacts. theano.OrderedUpdates: updates.

step_sample(*params)[source]¶

RNN step sample function for scan.

A convenience function for scan, this method samples the output given the input, returning the current states and sample.

step_sample_preact(*params)[source]¶

Returns preact for sampling step.

class cortex.models.rnn.SimpleRNN(dim_in, dim_h, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.models.rnn.RNN

Simple RNN class, single hidden layer.

class cortex.models.Layer(name='', excludes=[], learn=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Basic layer class.

name¶

str – name of layer.

dict – dictionary of numpy.arrays
